com.facebook.buck.util.autosparse

Class HgAutoSparseState

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.buck.util.autosparse.HgAutoSparseState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoSparseState

    public class HgAutoSparseState
extends Object
implements AutoSparseState
    AutoSparseState for a mercurial repository.

    When access to the manifest is requested, load the manifest in chunks around the current path, and store the information in hgManifest (containing ManifestInfo entries). rawmanifestSeen contains a cache of paths for which we already looked up a subtree to avoid repeatedly loading empty subtrees.

    When adding files to the sparse profile, the parent directory is added instead, to minimise the sparse profile. An exception is made for paths in the ignore set; for those only the direct file path is added to the profile. This makes it possible to quickly add a series of subdirectories to the profile, but lets us keep some directories (like the project root) out of the sparse profile to prevent extending a sparse profile too far. Only directories which contain files in the manifest (and not just other directories) are explicitly included in the sparse profile.

    Another optimisation is that once a parent directory has been added to the profile, any child paths are ignored. After all, these are already going to be part of the working copy once the parent directory has been materialised.

      • addBuckOut

        public void addBuckOut(Path buckOut)
        Description copied from interface: AutoSparseState
        Register a known buck-out path with the state, so it knows to ignore such paths.

        This is an optimisation strategy, not passing these in could result in slower sparse state tracking.

        Specified by:
        addBuckOut in interface AutoSparseState
        Parameters:
        buckOut - The path to a buck-out directory; any path below this will be ignored from a sparse state point of view.

        Specified by:
